Articles.Content:
Whenever I build/fly a craft in my KSP install, it stutters or freezes or even crashes my game. RAM usage isn't high, it's pinned at 5GB according to task manager.

Logs are attached below.

KSP.log
Player.log
According to the log you've got some serious issues with FAR.

You’re running far too many mods for just 8GB of RAM- I have trouble running RSS with 32GB of RAM! I can’t see the logs properly (they never work on a tablet) but FAR looks broken and I wouldn’t be surprised if you were just running out of memory. You should probably cut down on the mods you’re using- especially memory-heavy stuff like BDB- to improve overall performance and loading times, and I suggest creating a completely clean install of KSP then redownloading your mods into that.

4 hours ago, jimmymcgoochie said:

You’re running far too many mods for just 8GB of RAM- I have trouble running RSS with 32GB of RAM! I can’t see the logs properly (they never work on a tablet) but FAR looks broken and I wouldn’t be surprised if you were just running out of memory. You should probably cut down on the mods you’re using- especially memory-heavy stuff like BDB- to improve overall performance and loading times, and I suggest creating a completely clean install of KSP then redownloading your mods into that.

 

On 2/17/2021 at 2:38 AM, kylelander said:

RAM usage isn't high, it's pinned at 5GB according to task manager.

As you can see, RAM usage is an issue. I seriously think it IS FAR, and a reinstall has "fixed" it (no more FAR VOXEL ERROR log spam)

45 minutes ago, kylelander said:

As you can see, RAM usage is an issue. I seriously think it IS FAR, and a reinstall has "fixed" it (no more FAR VOXEL ERROR log spam)

Task manager regularly underestimates how much RAM KSP is using by up to 10GB for me based on how much RAM is in use vs what it says KSP is using; I'm genuinely amazed that you even got RSS/RO to work with only 8GB without the whole game stuttering to a halt when you launch anything bigger than a large firework.

15 hours ago, jimmymcgoochie said:

Task manager regularly underestimates how much RAM KSP is using by up to 10GB for me based on how much RAM is in use vs what it says KSP is using; I'm genuinely amazed that you even got RSS/RO to work with only 8GB without the whole game stuttering to a halt when you launch anything bigger than a large firework.

Yeah. Anything with 80+ parts takes FOREVER to load, but the game is still very much playable. (Except for the loading times, those are atrocious even on an SSD)
